byline.contributor: J. David Goodman and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.
byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and JESSE McKINLEY

abstract: New York State Board of Elections investigation has found strong evidence of violations of campaign finance law by fund-raising team put together by Mayor Bill de Blasio for Democrats running for State Senate seats in 2014; board and prosecutors are looking at whether efforts were made to illegally circumvent limits on campaign contributions to individual candidates.

headline.print_headline: De Blasio Team Violated Campaign Finance Laws, Report Says
headline.main: De Blasio Team Violated Campaign Finance Laws, Report Says

snippet: An investigation by the New York State Board of Elections found evidence of flagrant violations by a team of people that Mayor Bill de Blasio created to raise money for Democrats, according to the report.
lead_paragraph: An investigation by the New York State Board of Elections found evidence of flagrant violations by a team of people that Mayor Bill de Blasio created to raise money for Democrats, according to the report.
